hypothesis_content.title: Stress Regime Flight-to-Liquidity Reversal
hypothesis_content.statement: During a STRESS regime, if the aggregate open interest (OI) for top 5 perpetual swaps (BTC, ETH, SOL, XRP, DOGE) drops by more than 15% over 3 days while price decline slows (3-day RSI(14) > 25), it indicates capitulation. A long position in BTC will yield a positive risk-adjusted return over the next 5 days as liquidity returns.
hypothesis_content.rationale: A sharp OI decline in Stress indicates forced deleveraging and liquidation cascades are exhausting. When paired with slowing negative momentum (RSI condition), it suggests the selling pressure is becoming climactic. The most liquid asset (BTC) is the first to stabilize and attract capital as fear subsides, leading to a sharp, albeit potentially temporary, relief bounce.
entry_conditions: 3-day percentage change in Aggregate Top 5 Crypto Perp OI < -15%
Enter long BTC at next 4-hour candle close

exit_conditions.take_profit: 5 days after entry, or a 10% gain.
exit_conditions.stop_loss: BTC price makes a new 3-day low after entry.

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: The average 5-day return of BTC following this signal during Stress regimes is not positive, or the Sharpe Ratio of the strategy is < 0.5.
